nodes.text: I did it! I found the Raven Statue!
Somehow, I just don't think that this is the right statue. Pity that.
So, according to the plaque, this statue is a memorial to my father. My father, the Raven of Sardonia. My father, the thief.
This room is Donal's memorial, but I don't see a sarcophagus. I guess he wasn't buried here.
Could he still be alive?
If so, I have a lot of things to say to him. Not all of it will be polite.
Yeah, well, my mother and Uncle Shamus seemed to think my father was dead. He probably did die years ago.
This is as close to a gravesite for my father as there is.
Maybe there is a way to summon my father's ghost here.
Okay, so how does this go... I guess I introduce myself... Then eat... then spill blood on something or other.
Okay, Donal O'Conner, I'm your son, Shawn. Shawn O'Conner. You may not recognize me - you've been dead most of my life. I've grown a lot since then. Anyway, Donal, are you listening to me?
Now all I'll need for the ceremony is something to eat or drink.
Well, I like to eat apples... maybe my father did, too.
Okay, so, this is a yummy apple here, I'm sharing it with you, Donal. Hope you like it.
Mmmmm... Good.

Let's see... I've still got an apple tart wrapped up in my pack. It's from Chef Kinah's kitchen and she makes the best food. I'm sure you'll like this, um... Dad. It's about as good a tart as you can eat.
Then again, you probably can't taste much, being dead and all. But still I'm sharing it with you.
Mmmmm, sweet and crunchy and spicy - I can see why people celebrate the Nights of the Dead by making these tarts. It's worth coming back from the grave to get these.
Ah, I have a bottle of wine from the castle. They made good wine there - I'm sure you'll like it. It aged well.
So, I'm sharing this wine with you. The sort of thing we'd do together if you were still alive.
Although we probably wouldn't be doing it in the Catacombs.
Ah, good stuff.
Although drinking an entire bottle of wine in the middle of the catacombs might not have been the wisest thing I could do. Probably about on par with raising a ghost from the grave...
I have this bottle of Golden Wine that I was saving for a special occasion...
I guess that meeting your father for the first time since you were little probably counts as a special occasion.
So, Donal O'Conner, here's to you!
Ah, now that is good stuff. A heady bouquet of honey baked apples with caramel and a hint of vanilla. It's lush and warming and...
Whoa! Why is everything sort of blurred and moving all of a sudden? Is it an earthquake or did this wine just hit me with a brick?
Hmmm... this Dryad's Kiss Wine is supposed to be the best wine that there is. It's really valuable. I hope you appreciate the sacrifice I am making for you Donal by drinking this.
I wouldn't drink this wine for just anyone, you know.

So, Donal O'Conner -
"Always remember to forget
The troubles that passed away.
But never forget to remember
The blessings that come each day!"
Sláinte!
Wow, suddenly this room is all aglow. Everything radiates with the past events and the future possibilities. It's all so incredibly beautiful!
I can see flowing before my eyes all the choices that I've made in my life that led up to this moment in time. The good, the bad, they've all made me who I am.
Donal O'Conner, I call to you! I am your son. Join me here so that we can share this moment together. Join me so I can learn more of you and the choices you have made in life!
Wait... there was something about sharing food or drink. I don't have anything with me right now, so I guess I'll have to go scrounge something.
Sorry about that, Dad. Guess we'll have to talk another time.
I'll have to wait until after dinnertime to try to summon my father's ghost. That's when the ghosts come out in the Nights of the Dead.
I get the feeling that the Raven is watching me... like it's expecting something. It's practically taunting me.
Hey, maybe it's not a Raven at all... maybe it's a Mockingjay.
It was nice seeing you, Donal. I'm glad we had a chance to talk.
Okay, so this next part is the blood sacrifice part. I need to spill blood on something that once belonged to Donal O'Conner.
Okay, the blood part is kind of nasty. But what do I have that belonged to my father?
Well, this statue is like the Raven Statue my father owned... maybe it will work.
Okay, first I have to cut myself to drip some blood on it.
Ouch! That hurt more than I thought it would.
Okay, now I drip some blood on the statue...
So, Donal O'Conner, I offer you my blood flowing onto the symbol of your position as Raven of Sardonia. Use this sacrifice to come here. I need to speak to you.
Nothing's happening. I guess this stone raven statue didn't really belong to my father.
Okay, I have this Lucky Coin that I guess has something to do with the Raven Statue. Maybe it belonged to my father.
I need to cut myself on the hand and bleed onto the coin...
Ugh. That hurts like Hades!
By my blood and by this coin, Donal O'Conner, I summon you back to this world. Use this sacrifice to cross the gate of Shadows!
The only thing I have that I know has connection to Donal O'Conner is me. I am blood of his blood. So maybe I can make this work.
I'll just cut my hand open with my dagger...
Ack! Why did that hurt so much? It's just a little cut.
Anyway, by this sacrifice of blood of your blood, Donal O'Conner, come to me. Use this power that I offer you freely to cross the spirit gate.
Donal O'Conner, come to me!
Ow!
What just hit me? I guess I should have been kneeling for this.
Shawn... My boy... 'tis glad I am to see you so like a man before me. You look so much like your mother - you've got her eyes.
Donal... Dad... I have so much I want to ask you... I just don't know what to say...
What happened to you? How did you die? Were you murdered by your brother?
Shamus was me brother! He was me best friend. So we just happened to be squabbling and it came to blows... It wouldn't be the first argument between us to be settled with a fist fight.
It just happened to be our last argument. I lost me footing and fell off the cliffside onto the rocks and the sea. They never did find me body.
Ugh... I don't feel well.
So, did you really have the Raven Statue... Were you really the king of thieves in all Sardonia?

I was at that. With the Raven, I had the power to affect the lives of everyone around me. No city guard dared to cross me. I had wealth and influence and lived better than the very prince of Sardonia.
Did you really try to all give that up, or is that just a rumor?

Your mother never liked the notion of where the money was coming from. I kept telling her that the rich buggers deserved to lose their money. They stole it from the people who worked for them in the first place.
But Nora thought that stealing was wrong, no matter who you stole from. She said she'd rather be poor than cause other people grief by my actions.
There was naught I could do or say to make Nora happy about what I was doing. So, aye, I wanted to give the bloody raven away where no one would ever use it to rule Sardonia again.
Oh, ugh... I'm starting to shiver and shake now.
So you don't blame your brother for your death?
Shamus and I, we did everything together. We were rebels against Albion. We came to Sardonia together. He was me second in command as the Raven of Sardonia.
Nora always thought that Shamus was a bad influence on me. Truth to be told, I was the bad influence.
It's so cold in here now.
As the Raven, you ruled all thieves. What did you do - give them all orders? Did they have to pay you taxes or something?
As Raven, I kept the other thieves in line. No one could steal in Sardonia without my say-so. They belonged to the guild or they were shanghaied and kicked off the island.

Before me time as Raven, anyone who crossed the old Raven was badly beaten or was killed. The old Raven was vicious and ruled like a tyrant. Shamus and me was disciplined near to death several times before I stole the Raven and took over the guild.
And yeah, as Raven, I had first pick of anything stolen and a tithe of every take the guild members brought in.
I'm starting to feel a bit dizzy.
Did you know Master von Urwald, my instructor at Hero University?
Gerhard, aye, we knew him. He came here when I was Raven. We had a long talk, him and me.
He sounded like Nora, telling me that being a Raven hurt people. Merchants stayed away from Sardonia in fear. The stronger the Thieves' Guild got, the worse it was for the poor and the struggling.
And he was right and Nora was right. All I wanted was to make a good place for Nora and you and Shamus to live, but it was all going to Hades.
I had to give the Raven up, Shawn. I had to do right by you and Nora. I had to make sure that no one ever became Raven again.
I just didn't mean for it all to happen the way it did, Shawn. I never wanted to leave you and Nora.
It's getting darker and colder in here. I don't think I can stand much more of this.
There's so much more I want to ask you, but this is killing me. I have to say farewell, Donal... father. It was really good to speak to you...
I want you to know that I'm so proud of you, Shawn. You're every bit the son I hoped to have. Give me love to Nora for me. Take care of yourself...
I feel awful. I hope I can make it back to the castle without dying. That would be too ironic.

nodes.name: My Father's Ghost
nodes.description: I got to really speak to my father. He said that he was proud of me. I got to say goodbye. It's weird... I feel happy and sad at the same time.
